verbs.description: unwork (third-person singular simple present unworks, present participle unworking, simple past and past participle unworked or (archaic) unwrought)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To undo or destroy (work previously done).
The lack or absence of work; worklessness.
examples: That comfortable philosophy which modern transcendentalism has but dimly shadowed forth — that poetic agrarianism, which gives all to each and each to all— is the real life of this city of unwork.
